author: arnetheduck
content: the format per se supports non-linear, though for interchange of finalized blocks, it makes sense to constrain it - hm, perhaps a flag is in order for this case - it's a feature of the plain index that calculating the index offset is `O(1)` and that when streaming blocks, there's a linear read which makes it efficient in terms of disk access - this is the significant advantage in terms of performance because disk seeks are no longer random and caches work much better

author: arnetheduck
content: one root per branch gets tricky - the branches share ancestors most likely so you need to create a linked list of indices basically - if anything, I'd replicate the git index files here 1:1, one could say it does the exact same thing (actually, it does something slightly more complex because it supports multiple tails)
